Bibliographic References: CdL2, p. 126, fig. 122; MTL, fig. 443; MEL, colourNon Sepcifiedill. on p. 44; LIMC III, p. 891, Eros 485 b, pi. 635, 2; Albini, Il teatro greco, ill. on p. 49
Imagery Description: (a) HalfNon Sepcifieddraped maenad, with flute in right hand and in left a thyrsus, from which hangs a phlyax mask (B), bending forward in front of seated Dionysos, with drapery over his lower limbs, holding a kantharos in his right hand and a thyrsus, with suspended bell at top, in his left; beside him is a table with four eggs on it, and behind him a maenad, wearing a loinNon Sepcifiedcloth, and holding an egg in her outstretched right hand and a flute in her left
